results.title: Can a parent be human?
results.brief_description: An open-ended film from the Searching Years series which provides role-playing situations concerning communication between parents and children. Compares ways in which parents frighten children with ways in which they make successful contact.

results.title: Can-can
results.creator_credit: Suffolk-Cummings Productions, Jack Cummings and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: It’s 1896 and the “naughty” Can-Can has been banned in Paris. That doesn’t stop a vivacious cafe owner, (Shirley MacLaine), from performing it anyway, much to the delight of her patrons. She’s been able to ignore the law because her clever lawyer, (Frank Sinatra), has a corrupt judge, (Maurice Chevalier), in his pocket. Their sweet setup abruptly changes when a new judge, (Louis Jourdan), decides to put a stop to this shocking behaviour. Little does he know, that the real fun and excitement is just beginning! Features three Cole Porter songs that were not in the original hit show, lavish sets, stunning costumes and plenty of high-stepping dance numbers. Like Paris in the summer, Can-Can sizzles!

results.title: Can't you bloody-well read?!
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Pepper Audio Visual, Max Pepper and John Dick
results.brief_description: A poignant study of adult illiteracy and its effect on the lives of one in ten adults in our community. The Department of Further Education is working on a new program that may provide an answer in the field of reading education. The aim of the film is to remove some of the shame illiterate people in the community feel, and to convince them they should do something about it.

results.title: Campbell's Kingdom
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Betty E. Box and Ralph Thomas
results.brief_description: After being told that he only has six months to live, Englishman Bruce Campbell (Dirk Bogarde) dedicates his last days to vindicating his late grandfather’s name. His grandfather long held the belief that his land in the Canadian Rocky Mountains, or as he referred to it, ‘kingdom’, contained precious oil reserves; he was alone in his convictions. Bruce, who is now left with the land is determined to strike oil and comes up against fierce resistance from the leader of a construction gang, Owen Morgan (Stanley Baker). With nothing to lose and a suspicion that they are trying to prevent him from discovering the truth, Bruce has a fatalistic determination to get to the bottom of things. Based on the novel by Hammond Innes. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael Craig and James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Camp schools
results.creator_credit: British Films and National Camps Corporation
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the National Camps Corporation which provides school accommodation for children in need of open-air treatment. A visit is paid to a typical school to show the accommodation provided and the variety of activities undertaken.

results.title: Camouflage in nature by pattern matching
results.brief_description: Explains how many animals bear protective colour patterns which blend with their variegated surroundings, thus providing a measure of protection. The film illustrates how those animals most needing protection, because of age, sex, or lack of ability to defend themselves, generally have subdued colouring. In contrast other animals, of a more offensive nature, have bold markings and dazzling effects.

results.title: Camille Claudel
results.brief_description: Artistic genius and the descent into madness are at the centre of this stunning drama about Camille Claudel. An independent woman, she ventured into the male dominated sphere of sculpture in the 1880’s and left an indelible mark on the genre. After achieving an apprenticeship to renowned sculptor, Auguste Rodin (24 years older than she), and reaching a level of intimacy with him, she longs for more. His refusal initiates a decline in their relationship and her sanity. Based upon the biography of Camille Claudel by Rein-Marie Paris, great niece of Camille, this hauntingly dark and brooding film will sweep its audience along the raging torrent that was Camille Claudel’s life. Stars Gerard Depardieu and Isabelle Adjani. English subtitles with French dialogue.
